info: This session will focus on the relevance of open data in cities, its importance for most initiatives, proposals or projects and how the standardization of data will help unlimitedly to governments and administrations. Five panelists will present different appealing projects that show why open data is a valuable asset in cities all over the world.
conference_notes:
The keywords of these speeches were: open contracting, transparency, accountability, open government, open data and civic tech to empower citizens.
Cities are facing the same open data problems and they need a modular open cities suite of applications instead of just opening the data; it is not enough. It is relevant to first present the ingredients for how you opened the data in the first place so other cities can reuse the recipe. Challenges of cities must be solved also in collaboration with companies interested in open data. City data needs to be global as global are cities’ needs and problems. It must to be part of the global solution.
name: Data + Cities I
